    • Method Detail

      • tokenBased

        public static AuthenticationHandler tokenBased(SensitiveInformationProvider data)
        Build authentication mechanism that will keep the session alive via the use of session token. The mechanism will never log out, but the session may expire if not refresh regularly. This is potentially unsafe, as it will eventually store a plain-text access token on the hard drive, for everyone to see.
        Parameters:
        data - Provider for the sensitive information, such as passwords and tokens.
        Returns:
        The desired authentication method.

      • passwordBased

        public static AuthenticationHandler passwordBased(SensitiveInformationProvider data)
        Build authentication mechanism that will log out at the end of RoboZonky's operations. This will ignore the access tokens.
        Parameters:
        data - Provider for the sensitive information, such as passwords and tokens.
        Returns:
        The desired authentication method.

      • withTokenRefreshingBeforeExpiration

        public AuthenticationHandler withTokenRefreshingBeforeExpiration(long time,
                                                                 TemporalUnit unit)
        Optionally provide the earliest time before the token expiration at which the access token should be refreshed. The token will only be refreshed if RoboZonky is launched some time between then and the token expiration. If this method is not called, the default value is tokenRefreshBeforeExpirationInSeconds seconds.
        Parameters:
        time - Access token will be refreshed after expiration minus this.
        unit - Unit of time applied to the previous argument.
        Returns:
        This.

      • build

        public Authenticator build(boolean isDryRun)
        Based on information received until this point, decide on the proper authentication method.
        Parameters:
        isDryRun - Whether or not we should authenticate to an API that is not allowed to invest.
        Returns:
        Authentication method matching user preferences.

      • processToken

        public boolean processToken(ZonkyApiToken token)
        Decide whether or not to log out, based on user preferences.
        Parameters:
        token - Token in question.
        Returns:
        True if RoboZonky should log out, false otherwise.
